result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance Lamar Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eric R. Hart in court for Terrance Lamar Thomas.  Assistant District Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in court for status of counsel.  Defense has received partial discovery. State and Defense will be discussing an offer as well.  At the request of defense counsel, this matter is adjourned for additional scheduling in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Terrance Lamar Thomas.  Assistant District Attorney Jack T Eichorst appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case before the court for final pre trial.  The defendant requests to proceed pro se.  Defense counsel requests to withdraw.  Statements made, the Court will allow Attorney Kuehn to withdraw as counsel of record. The court finds good cause to vacate the speedy trial scheduled for 10/10.  The Court held discussion with defendant advising him that an attorney could be appointed, the defendant agreed to the appointment of counsel.  
Court appoints Attorney Eric Hart who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Order for counsel signed and filed.
Court orders no recoupment as to repayment to the County.  Case adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (10 pages) commencing 05-13-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Terrance Lamar Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin. . Parties before the court for final pre trial. Medical records have not been received by State or Defense.  The State had sent a medical release form to victim, the State has not received the signed release.  Court ordered this matter adjourned for an additional final pretrial in Br45.  mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas not in court, in custody, CJF.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA reads victim statement into the record  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in custody from CJF, pro se.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant awaiting SPD appointment.    Defendant appears without counsel.   The court appointed attorney Lori Kuehn, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in custody, CJF via Zoom.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendants request for new SPD counsel granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Wells.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HLC (dob 10/30/1980)

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Return on Doctors report. 
Defendant does not wish to comply with competency evaluation. Defense counsel believes the defendant is competent and WITHDRAWS request for Competency evaluation. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Initial Appearance in branch 34. 
  Initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned for defendant to be produced to court.  Return on Dr report May 2, 2022, 1:30 room 502SB.  kmw
WFU letter
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for.  Defendant has refused to appear via zoom since March 31, 2022.  He does not wish to waive his right to appear in person.  Court believes the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
Livestream link for next court date:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Terrance Lamar Thomas not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for.  Defendant has refused to appear via zoom or speak to any attorney for the past three days.  Court adjourns case to allow defendant to make appearance for Initial Appearance.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
